moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nc3 c5: this to allow knight out to protect king pawn without trapping c7 pawn
moves.4. Bc4: i can only assume this to be a standard move attacking f7 pawn preparing the way for knight to take h8 rook and in turn takes a hold on centre of the board
moves.4... Nf6: ultimately to allow a fight for d5
moves.6... a6: ok then 2 can play at that game !! but seriously this'll allow me to force his bishop out of the way
moves.7. d3: to allow bishop room to manoeuvre?
moves.7... Rb8: mmmm all this to protect b7 pawn when i advance it. Don't know whether it's worth it but want to start pushing up the board now.
moves.8. Bg5: aah yes bishop out.. Will he really do knight for bishop ?? probably not i think just prevent me moving knight for a bit.. why ??
moves.8... Be7: don't like it so give added protection for queen
moves.9. Bxf6: oh didn't think he'd do that really can't see what this achieves. can't move knight to g5 as he must know i'll take bishop with my bishop which protects g5 ?? am i missing something here ??
moves.9... Bxf6: got to do this need pawn for defense only move that makes sense... feel a little bit vulnerable here he's chosing my moves for me
moves.10... Qb6: thought about move to c7 here but just thought i'd test the water and see what happens if i attack pawn.....he must move rook or perhaps pawn but maybe he'll move his queen allowing me to attack his f3 knight with bishop !! yeah right !
moves.11. Rb1: as predicted foolish of me really...though you never know.  wasted move though.
moves.11... Qc7: back to original plan queen c7 gonna advance pawn
moves.12. h3: well that stops a move to g4 with bishop
moves.12... Bxh3: gave this move a lot of thought as it puts me at quite a bit of a piece disadvantage but this will open his king up
moves.13... Ne7: trying to get a bit of a defense here at the same time as putting some pieces across this side of the board for an attack.. he's not got a lot of options ere he needs to get his king safe which i hope will give me a couple of free moves
moves.15... Qh3: trying to pen the king in a little don't really want him to get e2 at the momentn not sure what he is going to do here
moves.16. Re3: that was a good move that's put me under pressure to save my queen and h8 rook
moves.16... Nxd5: eliminating danger of rook attack by removing bishop i expect him to take this then i'll take pawn on h4
moves.17. Nxd5 Bxh4 18. Nxe5 Qc8 19. Qg4 Qxg4+: oooh thankfully he's missed the fork opportunity i saw that too late. could have been game over
moves.23. Nf5+ Kg6 24. Nxh4+ gxh4 25. Rxh4 f5: open board up al;low rook through. struggling a little here
moves.26. exf5+ Kg5 27. Rxh7 Rxf5 28. c4 b5: just trying to push up a bit here but not really much i can do here
moves.29. Nc7 b4 30. axb4 cxb4 31. Nxa6 Rb6 32: try to salvage game and push king up.  perhaps should have looked at this a bit sooner
moves.33. b3 Kf3 34. Kf1 Rg5: getting rook in position to move up to g2
moves.35. Ra4 d5: resigning the fact that pawns are now of no use to me i move it out of the way to allow rook through
moves.36. Rf7+: missed this move i was expecting him to take a pawn...annoying
moves.36... Kg4 37. Nxb4 Rh6: didn't want to move here really wanted to go to g6 but thought better of it as i need to get king out of way
moves.38. Nxd5 Kh3: probably gone wrong with rook move previously as king now moves into it's path but moving king up to try and reach h1 or at least h2 to allow rook to come up.  feel at the moment this is all in vain and a little late but can't see another option
